description: Roses are red, violets are blue and I think KDE is violating us

Not sure why this has to be a separate program, instead of being drag-and-drop inside the launcher

Trying to arrange in KMenuEdit is buggy. (dragging above an existing item will put it UNDER it, the only way to add a new item to the top of a menu is to drag to the top, then drag the old top back to top to pop it down)

There's no good way to manually order, it seems to work off of sub-categories, and alphabetical, so you're stuck doing awkward things like making a new generic subcategory, AND renaming "Steam" to "a Steam"

It just feels bad :/
i accidently deleted all the applcation with catagries
summary: please add revert back to default button

description: It could only be better by synchronising my customisations across devices.
summary: Compact, powerful, and easy to use

description: It does exactly what it was supposed to. The only thing I miss is the ability to extract icons from appImage packages to be used as icons. Most of us do use this tool to create shortcuts for that type of app...
